page.title: 03ROADS AND TRACKS NEAR MILTON
page.content: Communications in our area are good.We can use main roads,numerous tracks and several Rights Of Way.The A911 comes west from Glenrothes,by_passes Milton and goes to Windygates Cross.There the A915 from Leven comes from the east, and the A916 from Kennoway from the north.The A915 turns south,descends to cross the River Leven at Cameron Bridge,then goes west to Kirkcaldy.The B932 goes from Cameron,up Quarry Brae and through Methilhill.{Tracks}are everywhere in our farming and river valley area,and excellent walks can be taken.One{Right of Way}goes from the stile on the A911 east of Milton,north over Markinch Burn,then on to Star of Markinch.Another goes north from the housing scheme at Methil,across the River Leven at a footbridge,over the A915,through Duniface Farm then on to Kennoway.
